tkfeYXGlUv77IxW7yJDXow.text: Great pizza, my wife's beef brisket sandwich was perfect. Our first time and we will be back.

chnl-z7WSczjz_1kKfOeuw.text: We love this restaurant. The food is great. I wish they were on the Nowait app as they can be super busy and there is no where to wait comfortably. Would go there more if they had the app. No affiliation, just use that for OTB at north park and works like a charm.   Please please please get Nowait app!

R3-HA21pqI0Iv_2mCbProQ.text: A Saturday evening during March Madness. The food was very good. Burgers, MacNCheese, salads, etc. The service was somewhere between horrible and hilarious. Hardworking, courteous servers of various experience levels put in a very bad situation by the "ownermanagercook". Being seated we were told there would be an hour food wait after ordering. It was only 55 minutes though. There are maybe 20 tables in this restaurant, with 5-6 servers tending to them, desparately trying to apologize for the slowness of the kitchen and then later(9pm) for the running out of various menu items, some necessary to making a hamburger. I will mention again that the food tasted great and was beyond our expectations. But it may be the poorest run restaurant I've ever visited. It was actually entertainingly captivating. Kept wondering what twist was next or if we were on a reality candid camera show. Hope they fix things. The food was very good. Beer selection solid.

lnOyME1CNJHqieibnFQCig.text: Let me first start off by saying the food here is delicious. The server we had Saturday afternoon gave great recommendations as well as knew the menu to answer any questions we had very quickly. The server Tara was also very attentive to our table as well as other tables as she worked the entire restaurant. For it being our first experience here ever I was beyond happy with our food and service. There is no kids menu but our server suggested chicken tenders or macaroni and cheese for our son. We ordered macaroni and cheese and our son loved it. We will definitely be back.

TTk88ZS7w_M7V8sheXejlQ.text: This place came highly recommended from a friend of ours. We came and tried it out for my birthday on 8/1 and we were not disappointed. All fresh ingredients, nothing frozen. Fried pretzels with tomato and jalapeno beer cheese are absolutely delicious and the pepperoni pan pizza, OMG, phenomenal!! We came back today for lunch and had the fried catfish sandwich and bacon cheeseburger. We were not disappointed. The smoked bean and potato salad sides are delicious. We'll definitely be coming back for more!!! The service was also fantastic which made our entire experience quite enjoyable!

v0vRoqiFTA1xqSWoge0NCQ.text: My boyfriend and I were so excited for this restaurant to open because it's so close to his house! We have been here three different times and were happy each time. I suggest going on Wednesdays for wing night! Their wings are great! We also enjoyed the pizza, the crust is awesome. The meatballs and Cuban sandwich were just okay...which is why I chose 4 stars rather than 5. They also have a great beer selection!

Y388gnGxbjKs6K3JtOOCog.text: Delicious meats smoked fresh daily, wings were great, and the takeout containers were all cardboard :) Great service too!!

5pZRWvX_RRY0zcAdRlLBWQ.text: Food was great! However, we had a large party, waitresses were not permitted to separate checks, STUPID! It actually created more work for the waitresses, we all paid by credit card and had to tell them what we had, it was KAOS. Next time we are going to pretend we don't know each other.

1KJN9eG2aJCs4LfI5jpq9g.text: My wife and I yet to have a good exerience.  We have been to both locations, and neither is any better.  The service is horrible.  It took abput 20 minutes after sitting to finally order.  We went with another couple this evening, and each ordered an appetizer.  The first appetizer took 30 minutes and the waitress said "the wings need another 5 minutes".  15 minutes later (45 minutes after ordering - over an hour into being seated), we finally got our wings.  We were on our second wing when our meals arrived (well, all except my wife's pizza - that came out a few.minutes later, and the pepperoni and crust was burnt), which left absolutely no room on the table.  These restaurants first need to hire more staff, and second need to train their staff.  It shouldn't take over an hour and a half to finish your meal from the point you first sit down.

8SmZIYSxzi4qQ7iEQumxrg.text: My family and I came in fairly late night Saturday after getting back from vacation. We had a larger party of people (8). The food was fresh and hot, and portions were big. Pretzels were our favorite! Our server Lindsay was welcoming and happy to chat. Whole experience was smooth and a nice way to end vacation. We will be back!

e9UqVdLNS4Cz7mbs82rBvQ.text: Always willing to try some place new!  This place is pretty small and gets very crowded, so either prepare to wait or get there early.  The fish sandwiches here are really good.  The first time we went the fries were excellent as well, the second, not so much.  I am also told the soup is very good.  That will be the next thing I try!

Q2henh4HHZpyQ0tT3EALgg.text: Stopped in Barrel Junction last night. It was around 5:30 pm. The place had a good crowd in the front and rear of the restaurant. They have high tables and chairs at the front of the restaurant and regular low tables in the rear. I was seated at the "low" tables.   I had a bacon cheeseburger with all the standard condiments.  The burger is not a frozen patty. Its a large burger on a large bun that I needed to cut in half in order to eat. You get 2 sides with the burger. I ordered fries and sweet slaw. The fries were crunchy and not greasy. The slaw was in a condiment cup. Not much to taste. The burger was cooked as I requested and it was very juicy.  Bacon was very tasty. I could not eat the last bite of the burger and left some fries. I was stuffed.  For me,  cost of the meal was in proportion with the amount of food that I received.  The staff is pleasant and very attentive. I will definitely return to the Junction.

HcfRQeuDSkPIn8M2K0BXmQ.text: First time and last time here. My husband and I ordered takeout. The staff was friendly so that's the 1 star. He ordered the hog wild burger with a side of beans (very small portion) and fries. The burger was okay, but not worth the price. I ordered the southwest chicken salad, and it was awful. The lettuce was soggy and the container was almost falling apart because of how soggy the salad was from the salsa. I threw it out and ordered from another place. I also ordered a side of onion rings for $8 and got home only to find that I did not receive them. I called, and the best they could do was give me a credit for free onion rings next time I visit by taking my name and phone number. I can't say I'll visit this place again based on the food and how overpriced it is for the quality. I've attached a picture of my soggy salad. Don't waste your time or money here.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States

iyEoTD4p2lPima0APJI7Gg.text: I ordered the buffalo chicken calzone, it wasn't any good. I took one bite of it and told them I wasn't pleased with the dish. I told them that I would like to order something else and they insisted that I ate half of the calzone which I took one bite of. She also said I would be charged if I would order anything else.. as a frequent customer, the lack of customer service was poor and the attitude given to me from the bartender was unacceptable. That is the reason I am posting now. Bad food. Bad service

Ppke2Zcegx2otzEGuV1iaQ.text: The food and drinks are great. The only problem is with the service, and it's not the employees' fault at all. They are severely understaffed, and the staff does a great job trying to keep up, but they just don't have enough people. We'd eat there more often, but we feel that service is way too slow. For example, we were never checked on during our last visit, so we didn't even get a second round of drinks. Also, it took over a half hour from the time we ordered appetizers for them to get to us, and they basically served them at the time of the meal, so we had to send them back.

sjBteJI9kyRt8ns6r-W7_w.text: Finally, superb bar-food and beverages on the Route 8 corridor!  Great bar, 24 Drafts on tap, great building, great staff, and most importantly, a chef who is obviously passionate about making GREAT food!  Everything I've had on the menu so far, (I've been there about 10 times,) is unique in some way, and not unique because they put kale or something stupid like that on a burger...  They have a smoker in the kitchen and many of the menu items, pulled pork, brisket, wings, pulled chicken are smoked. Everything is just awesome.  I can't say enough good things about this place.    It's about 8 minutes up Route 8 from Etna so it's an easy reach for the Lawrenceville crowd.  Give this place a try!

oqh2rkfrzVeaM66h37YOmg.text: It was great! Pizza was delicious. So was the fish and shrimp basket. Salad was fresh. Very consistent. There is always a solid beer selection.

BgkjJr3PFT8iQe_C33Yg8Q.text: Don't bother coming if you have kids....no children's menu and especially limited seating for children. If they are hosting a party 2/3 of the seating is gone...the majority of the remaining seating is stools. Not good for kids under 10.  There always seems to be something occurring here that turns me away.  Other than that the food, drink and staff are fine.

uYY83QP2u7SWbO8gePiw7Q.text: Well if the web site state kitchen till midnight maybe on a Friday they should be open till at least 11:00. O well will not try again considering I live five minutes away that a-shame Casey's kitchen says till midnight and they took my order at 11:00 with no questions asked . Looks like Casey's is the late night spot.

CydbxdYc9BJbMWRs1k6AuA.text: Stopped in for some apps on a Friday night. The atmosphere has a brewery feel. They have an extensive draft list but I opted for a glass of wine off the very basic but adequate wine list. We had side salads, the cilantro lime dressing was super refreshing and definitely homemade. We ordered three apps. The herbed chicken tenders. This could be a perfect meal for me. The other two were the fish apps, Cajun catfish and buffalo fish bits. They were both good. I would order the buffalo again. Overall, a nice experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Side salad minus tomatoes
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Garden vegetable chicken soup
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Herbed chicken tenders

D6cR4fq6wFSnXs8Eo2gS_A.text: It's a bar with bar food. I think beer drinkers like it, but for me, the mixed drink tasted completely void of alcohol, even after I asked it to be remade in a rocks glass rather than a large drinking glass. Ordered the cob salad and it was meh. Rumor has it the pizza is good, but a few people ordered it and it looked average. In all fairness I didn't try it, so maybe it rocks, but I didn't hear anyone raving about it.

jsHv_PiG32eOmNcfG2d2mA.text: Delicious food and generous portions which is fitting since most sandwiches are $12 or more but they come with two sides. (Note: you can order fries even though they are not listed as an option on the menu)  So far I've tried a burger and the chicken Parmesan sandwich. Both were excellent and a really good quality. The chicken parm had pepperoni on it and I personally judge a place based on their pepperoni. Barrel junction offers the small pepperoni that curls when cooked and collects all of the grease. What can I say, I like grease and this pepperoni is my favorite! The nachos and Bavarian pretzels are also delicious.   I like that they offer a weekly draft and cocktail and that they have a decent beer selection.   Route 8 definitely needed a place like this!

5Rce_vaxNO-Ij0ZO8mLmtg.text: Nice place, very clean and very spacious dining rooms. Bar area was set up very nicely. Had a chicken parm Sammy which was very crisp and tasty with the sauce and pepperoni on it. I will definitely try this place again. Everyone was eating the burgers which seemed to be the hit on the menu. I will try them next time. Beer selection was very nice and varied and not all ipas.

jJb19_HSE989IoLixY_dhw.text: Not bad...after going to the original store in Gibsonia, we thought we'd check this one out. The food was very good. We were there at 1:30pm on a Friday.  Beer battered fish & shrimp basket $15, and a cheese burger $13, pitcher of beer $12ish.... the fries, slaw and soup (mushroom brie) sides, also good.   The fish & shrimp had 3 large fish pieces and 4 large shrimp...well worth the $15, but $13 for a cheese burger....it was a good cheese burger...but not sure why it's so expensive...it was a cheese burger. :/ Good food. Good service.

EJYrN8vshbM6MX136UzI7w.text: This is the 2nd location for this restaurant. We are regulars at the other location and when we heard there was a new location we just had to try it. It was only they're 3rd day open so we were curious how it would be. We went at about 5:30 on Saturday night and they were packed. The service was a little slow but I'm sure it will improve as they settle in. They have about 24 beers on tap, and just like the other location the food is awesome. They also have motorcycle parking. We will continue to be regulars at both locations.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. This is only the third day open

8CainQaoup3zsR8RNtwHSQ.text: We've been anticipating the second location in Shaler for some time now since we live up the hill. The official opening was last Wednesday. When you walk in, the expansive bar is to your left and the first thing you notice is the warm rustic decor and the vast array of beer selections. There is something for everyone. Lite Beer, IPA'S, pumpkin flavores, porters, etc. There are several high top long tables in the front of the bar with numerous large TV'S for sporting events. The dining areas is in the back with garage doors when weather permits.   A group of us sat at one of the large pub tables in the front and ordered a few beers and later a pepperoni pizza. The pizza was cooked to perfection with fresh ingredients and flavorable crust. My wife who is a pizza connoisseur commented that it is her new favorite. The bartenders are very attentive and helpful if you have any questions on the menu or beer.   Great addition to the neighborhood and much needed in an area with not many options. The place will only improve as they work out a few kinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Excellent pepperoni pizza. This is their small!

kIhFqwFti4ztoWV12Armpw.text: Ordered a strawberry pineapple sangria. Not one strawberry or pineapple in it. Very bland. Ordered wings extra crispy and they came extra rubbery. Stick to the beer if you go here. Won't be back.

vUhYoRo2El-tC3Dy1hRygQ.text: We waited too long for just ok food.  Nothing to write home about! Just typical bar food, so-so service. Don't think we will be back!

X4Z09Dd1kAfSQqZtyl1J0w.text: Eeeehhh...it smelled like smoke? I dunno what to say. My bf and I stopped at Barrel Junction after visiting a buddy who lives out that way and when i walked in I was pretty excited to eat some BBQ. He ordered a pulled pork sandwich with fries and I got the brisket sandwich (no bun because I am a loser sometimes) with spicy coleslaw and baked beans. I really liked my sides!! The coleslaw was spicy which is great because all things should be spicy and wonderful. The baked beans also had a kick but were rich and tangy as well. My brisket was not bad but it was a little bit strange. The slices were super thin and I could not detect any existence of that beautiful pink ring you want to see with your BBQ. I don't know if I am correct in my thinking but I almost felt as if it were lunch meat. I mean...I ate the whole thing. But on the level of amazing barbecues of meals past, this was not one of them. I wouldn't mind going back but I most likely would not be the one to suggest it.

2fb55tTyD38p6qRpLQqfQw.text: Great beer. Good food. Atmosphere is nice! Friendly staff. Great for the 30,40 something crowd not for children. Good local place to meet up and enjoy and evening.

3pSuo7_NQBZW1ZnroYONwg.text: We ordered take out- steak salad, good flavor, I had chicken bbq sandwich also good. Our major complaint, no silverware or napkins in the bag. We were not asked if we needed them or they would have gotten a higher rating.

WYfVGXl1R4hSCQBTQJ1G5g.text: First time was dinner on 9/3/17.  Had the shrimp and fish in beer batter basket and the fish was fresh and cooked just right and the shrimp was a little strong but edible.  Smoked beans were great and their version of sweet slaw was great.  My wife's pulled chicken sandwich was very good.  Great beer selection.  Our server Nadia was great. One negative was when they batter the shrimp they leave the tails on but cover them with batter.  If you batter tail-on shrimp you unbatter the tails before you fry them.  Or if you don't want to wipe off the batter on the tails PULL THEM OFF before you batter them.  Second negative was it was a little cool in the room which has large garage door like windows.  Which was okay until a server opened up one of the large doors letting in 55 degree air just to chill the room a little more.  I mean what the heck!!    All in all a good place with good basic food and I will go back and I won't let 2 little negatives turn me off to Barrel Junction.

jamV6yQt38lM7sJ7XOccDw.text: This place is hit or miss.  I normally get the fish and shrimp basket.  Sometimes everything is cooked perfectly and the service is great and other times the fish is under cooked or my server may be moody.   I normally have a good experience and the pro's outweigh the con's so I will be back.   Give it a try, it will be worth it.  The pizza is really good also!!

Ak65ui6s1STt5stq7HBUFQ.text: Pizza was the best thing we ordered. I asked for my wings to be well done, they came barely cooked. My husband got a sandwich that looked more like slop, he could not even pick it up. My husband and I ordered adult beverages, he got his and mine never came. Wait staff was scarce. Might order pizza for takeout and that's it.

KTJBUOT710V4Vm7RPsNZZw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I grew up right up the street and really wasn't expecting much from another bar on Route 8.  We came in for my mom's birthday and we had a decent amount of different food.  I ordered the fish sandwich which I really didn't think the sign outside would be correct in saying that it's the best, but it was incredible! And wayyyyy too big! The breading was perfect and it wasn't too greasy. I will say I tried all of the Cole slaws and none of them were good but that's minor. I also tried some wings and other then the garlic ones (which were not good) all the others were good.  I also highly recommend the sweet potato fries which were really good.   Our waitress was really nice and even though they were busy we didn't seem to wait too long for anything. Good addition to the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Wings (garlic ones were just ok)
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Nachos
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Fish sandwich! Excellent

1YnxSyps9jb_QB5xquLI4g.text: I went to Barrel Junction for the first time last night. It feels more like a sports bar than a restaurant. Of course, my party was seated directly in front of the bar on a Saturday night. They also have another seating area off to the back that I'm assuming is quieter and less crowded.   Though they were busy, my party of 7 was seated within five minutes. People who came in the door after us didn't seem to have a wait time either.   Our waitress wasn't seen often. We saw other waitresses pass us more frequently than we saw our own. At one point we assumed she was on lunch or possibly finished her shift. She would often leave to get a drink or boxes for our food and wouldn't return for a while.   The food didn't take too long to arrive. When we got our food it was extremely hot. You could tell it was just prepared, which is good.   Overall, I enjoyed my experience here. The food was good and the wait time for things wasn't horrible. The overall service could be better.  On a side note, they have one of the best buffalo chicken dips I've even had.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States

kbDbOW_FDKLGxn8fHpKCpA.text: New to the area and found this place through social media . Was looking forward to trying Barrel Junction . however the food was not superb and the overall experience was not memorable. Would not recommend the fish and shrimp platter. Service was disappointing and the sign to seat yourself was misleading for a first timer .

2rtHJ1K2UBTHArmJefS9mw.text: The restaurant was about 60 % full, no hostess the sign read, seat yourself.  We had no trouble finding a seat and it was wing night. The waitress could not of been more prompt. We placed our appetizer (wings) and then our meals. The wings were good and then dinner came. My husband ordered the Cajun burger which is described on the menu as having cheese, spicy slaw and onion straws on the sandwich. It arrived with cheese and lettuce. The waitress was informed, she lets the kitchen staff know and they send the slaw and rings in a  paper  container for my husband to create the specialty sandwich.  Other than the waitress no one came and apologized or offer a new sandwich created as described. Unfortunately, we will not return to this establishment.

8KhqSzL9Hnh3C0qlucqzhQ.text: We needed some lunch ...looked to our trusty yelp app for what was nearby and Barrel junction it is  its a sports bar with a back dining room the dining room is bland but it does have big garage door type windows I wonder if they are open in the warm months there are tvs at the bar menu has smoked offerings  salads  and what I chose  fish wedge  its actually a pretty cool sammie  pizza dough is the "wedge" acting as your bread fried fish with slaw and fries in the sammie tarter was on the side  all in all a nice spot for lunch

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Fish wedge

5bt3rkVDo5jRv80vtpauwA.text: My favorite restaurant in the North Hills! Soooooo good! The food is amazing! Staff is excellent awesome spot to watch a game. Great bar! The most amazing potato salad and sweet potato fries! Best Burger in Pittsburgh! Can't say enough good things about this place! I'm gluten free so the picture I'm posting  is one of their newer items the citrus turkey sandwich this one obviously is (bun less) due to my allergy but was absolutely delicious! Wings are great as well. This location is awesome if you want to have a drink or if you want to have dinner with the family. It's super clean which can't be said for a lot of restaurants in the area. Owner is very friendly and in the restaurant often. Music is also good. Just a great place to have a good meal or hang out the bar. We order take here also quiet often.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Citrus turkey sandwich (with out a bun)

TI4XnK_VBDvWl5vWavTORA.text: Their pizza is the best! We tried a traditional pizza with red sauce and pepperoni, as well as their take on the Chicago Deep Dish. While both were very good, the sauce and cheese combo on the traditional was out of this world. Very fresh tasting, and pairs perfectly with their beers on draft!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Chicago deep dish
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Pepperoni pizza
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Smoked Buffalo Chicken Sandwich

KnhySLS-J1uW0N4SnaFn3g.text: I have never had a bad experience here until today sat at the bar area ordered a drink and the lady working never came to take are order but went to the people that came in after us and took there's I tell you I will never go back very poor run place the girl that usually runs the bar at night is the best there who ever this lady tonight was should be fired I really like the food but now I will have doubts going back !!!!!

1t1zAv6Fvp4J2Z8PXd4YrA.text: My friend and I stopped here on our way home from antiquing in a lovely Sunday afternoon. I started with a turbo palmer... and turbo it is!! California Cobb salad was delicious .. avacado, bacon hard boiled egg cucumber yummy moist grilled chicken. My friend has the fish wedge. The pizza bread was better than prima fish and slaw great, fries kind of soggy and sub par. I would have also liked more of a dressing choice for my salad but all in all a great meal . I didn't have beer but the have a selection of 24 on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. California Cobb salad mmmmmm good
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Yummy fish wedge

B5vmnncRqWjObh2TOaZjgQ.text: This restaurant has pretty good food. The customer service is Horrible.  My husband and I stopped on Valentine's day (one of the biggest restaurant days on the planet) and the scheduler decided that having only two servers for the entire restaurant was a splendid idea. We waited 45 minutes for our food to come out. Not too much attention from server. Not to be deterred, we tried again last night (Friday) and there was a hostess there taking names. We knew it would be about 20 min but asked anyway. She stated, without even looking up, "20 or 30 min.  Maybe MORE, maybe LESS". With a look of pure disgust, kind of like " I don't give a #*%$ if you stay or not". So, we decided on another restaurant that was happy to serve us. Hint to the hostess: CUSTOMERS = JOB SECURITY.  There are lots of other restaurants that we will patronize instead.

k43Fk0WuqviMAn-jDRFeXw.text: The atmosphere is very nice and the restaurant is super clean and new. The beer selection is great and the menu is high end bar fare. We ordered wings and a burger and both were spot on. The three stars is due to this being the second time to the restaurant and having lousy help. The wait staff is off. I go back for the food and location but I will probably sit at the bar.

yf1rmmPuRBNVlz0Ws0V8Tg.text: Wow, what a find. Start with the smoked wings with habenaro mango sauce. I then had the bison dog. Fantastic. Snappy casing, a hint of spice, tons of provolone. Dee-lish.

24j9Je0YJ--8uOfc4Vlt5g.text: This is my favorite bar restaurant. Plenty of craft beers on tap. Their food is pretty damn amazing. Best beer battered fish sandwich I can find around. Pizza, wings, burgers, appetizers  all great. I'm not a huge fan of their fries but that's okay. Everything is reasonably priced. Now if people will stop crashing into the place that would be great lol

Wd__LhopYL57LeZ__i5SSw.text: This place has the absolute BEST buffalo chicken dip that I have ever tasted.  Nice and spicy with a perfect amount of burn, and I think they use smoked chicken because it has such a unique taste.  Definitely worth a trip or two back to get more!

vBYSeU15kx4YpBNMJCCqYA.text: This is our first visit, and it has been a really good experience. The wait wasn't long at all for 6:00 on a Friday night. We ordered the hot pretzels for an appetizer. The beer cheese is amazing, and so are the pretzels!   I ordered the pulled chicken club sandwich and it came with two sides. I picked the spicy slaw and fries. The spicy slaw has a decent kick to it, so unless you can handle more than a 5 on a scale of 1-10, then beware. I loved it! The sandwich and fries were great as well. Good flavor on the chicken.   My boyfriend ordered the pan pizza with pepperoni and it is a large portion. We have to take more than half home.   We had a great server. She was friendly and attentive. We are looking forward to coming again!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States
Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States

qES5Vc6XAqt0FkwJX-NWWw.text: This was our first visit to Barrel Junction and we were pleasantly surprised. The food was delicious, the staff was friendly, and our food arrived quickly. I had the brisket sandwich, fries & spicy slaw with a Raspberry Kiss to drink.(yum) My husband had the fish & shrimp basket (the shrimp were huge), fries, spicy slaw and a glass of blue moon. We can't wait to go back to try something else. We went on a Friday at 5:00pm

photos.caption: Photo of Barrel Junction - Allison Park, PA, United States. Brisket sandwich with fries &amp; spicy slaw.

NwlOUtQwJ3cOOw7cn04gag.text: Great new menu.  Grilled cheese was off the chart and glad the pastrami is permanently on the menu.  Great staff and atmosphere as usual.  Plus desserts...

_OA7bkYWeiWY4Nkj6j2E1A.text: Good beer selection. Food was mediocre. Waitresses are friendly. First visit the service seemed a little disorganized for example we ordered a salad and they brought out 2 not knowing our server already brought it out but then we never received our kids food. By the time we were able to flag someone down our kids already ate half our meal. Worth trying out but wouldn't go out of my way.
